intro: Conyza spathulifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf weed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Its leaves are ovate to broadly ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Conyza spathulifolia is known for its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its role as a weed in various ecosystems.
